articles.description: California is set to receive 327,000 doses of the COVID-19 vaccine from Pfizer in the coming weeks, Gov. Gavin Newsom announced Monday. “That will be California’s portion of the first distribution of vaccines,” Newsom said. The governor said the vaccines will…
articles.content:
California is set to receive 327,000 doses of the COVID-19 vaccine from Pfizer in the coming weeks, Gov. Gavin Newsom announced Monday.

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: First Alzheimer's blood test now on the market, without FDA approval - CBS News
articles.description: More than 5 million people in the United States and millions more around the world have Alzheimer's, the most common form of dementia.
articles.content: A company has started selling the first blood test to help diagnose Alzheimer's disease, a leap for the field that could make it much easier for people to learn whether they have dementia. It also ra… [+5646 chars]
